summary: The Cormorant Relief Act of 2025 mandates the Secretary of the Interior to reissue a depredation order allowing the taking of double-crested cormorants at aquaculture facilities. This reissued order expands the application to include additional states (California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey, Ohio, Pennsylvania, and Wisconsin) and extends coverage to lake and pond managers. The bill aims to protect aquaculture businesses from cormorant predation.
